raw_data_table_help: Table containing the raw BiolectorXT data with Well, Filterset, Time, and Cal columns
folder_metadata_help: Folder containing the BXT.json metadata file from Biolector XT
medium_table_help: Optional table with unique medium compositions (Medium, Component1, Component2, ...)
info_table_help: Optional table mapping wells to medium names (Well, Medium)
file_input_mode_help: Choose between uploading new files or selecting existing resources from the lab
missing_raw_data_table: ‚ö†Ô∏è Please upload or select a Raw Data Table
missing_folder_metadata: ‚ö†Ô∏è Please upload or select a Metadata Folder
must_select_correct_resources: Please select resources with the correct types
import_files_info: Upload the required files to start BiolectorXT microplate analysis. The plate_layout is optional for adding custom well labels.
dashboard_description: The BiolectorXT Dashboard is a Streamlit application designed for analyzing and visualizing fermentation data from BiolectorXT microplate readers.
no_biolector_recipe_found: No BiolectorXT recipe found. Click 'Create new recipe' to get started.
processing_detect: Automatic channel detection (Biomass, pH, O2, etc.)
processing_create: Creating one table per well with all channels
processing_missing: Detecting missing values from plate layout
results_cleaned: Cleaned and structured tables per well
results_metadata: Metadata table for ML feature extraction
missing_data_couples: ‚ö†Ô∏è Plate and Well pairs with missing data
distribution_single_batch: üîÑ Distribution by plate: Single plate detected
pca_data_info: Data is automatically extracted from available plate reader experiments.
hover_data_help: Select columns to display as metadata on hover over points (Plate, Trial, Date, etc.)
duplicate_plate_names_error: Error: Plate names must be unique. Please modify duplicate names.
plate_name_help: Optional custom name for the microplate
no_valid_samples: ‚ö†Ô∏è No valid wells found in this recipe.
no_data_matches_filters: No data matches the selected filters for {column}
pca_help_intro_text: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) reduces data dimensionality while preserving maximum information. It helps visualize relationships between wells and variables and identify groups or trends in the data.
qc_step_description: Quality check allows you to visualize data distributions and identify outliers for the selected wells.
qc_no_columns_available: No columns available for quality checks.
qc_max_missing_percentage_help: Wells with more than this percentage of missing data will be filtered
qc_required_columns_help: Wells must have data for all these columns
qc_min_data_points_description: Ensure wells have a minimum number of data points for specific columns.
qc_min_points_help: Minimum number of data points required for this column
qc_action_help: What to do if validation fails
qc_add_quality_tags_help: Add tags indicating which wells passed/failed quality checks
qc_cannot_retrieve_data: Cannot retrieve data from selection scenario
qc_tips_content: Quality checks help you identify and filter outliers or incomplete wells. Configure range validations, missing data thresholds, and minimum data points requirements to ensure data quality.
qc_launch_success: Quality check launched successfully! Scenario ID: {id}
qc_scenario_running_info: The quality check scenario is running. Results will appear once completed.
feature_extraction_help_content: Feature extraction transforms time series data into statistical features for machine learning analysis.
feature_extraction_results_interpretatio: Results show extracted features from fermentation curves, ready for further analysis.
min_dist_help: Controls how tightly UMAP packs points together. Lower values create more compact clusters.
normalize_data_help: Standardize features to have zero mean and unit variance before analysis.
columns_to_exclude_help: Select columns to exclude from the analysis.
umap_combines_two_types: UMAP combines two types of information:
umap_reveals_link: UMAP reveals the link between medium composition and fermentation performance.
same_color_grouped: Points of the same color grouped together: similar media produce similar results
different_colors_grouped: Points of different colors grouped together: different media can lead to similar performance
may_indicate: May indicate exceptional or problematic performance
identify_best_media: Identify the best performing media (isolated points in favorable zones)
find_common_characteristics: Find their common characteristics in the metadata
formulate_new_media: Formulate new media based on these characteristics
look_close_points: Look for points close to the best media but with different compositions
test_cheaper_ingredients: Test cheaper ingredients that maintain performance
new_batches_same_region: New batches should fall in the same region as validated batches
unexplored_areas: Unexplored areas in the UMAP space
plan_new_tests: Plan new tests to explore these areas
umap_preserves_local: UMAP preserves local structure but may distort global distances
normalization_crucial: Data normalization is crucial for meaningful results
multiple_projections: Multiple projections with different parameters help validate patterns
always_validate: Always validate findings with experimental data
n_neighbors_structure: n_neighbors: Influences local vs. global structure preservation
metric_distance: metric: Defines how distance is calculated
unsatisfactory_results: If results are unsatisfactory, try adjusting these parameters.
pls_train_interpretation: Training set prediction shows model fit quality on data used for training.
3d_visualization_description: Three-dimensional visualization adds an extra dimension for exploring data structure.
rotate_graph_tip: Rotate the graph to explore different angles
zoom_specific_areas: Zoom on specific areas to examine details
compare_2d_3d: Compare 2D and 3D views to validate patterns
rf_help_content: Random Forest regression predicts medium composition effects on fermentation performance.
rf_step_description: Random Forest uses multiple decision trees to create robust predictive models.
target_variables_help: Select the variables to predict (fermentation performance metrics).
test_size_help: Proportion of data reserved for testing (typically 0.2-0.3).
rf_guide_content: This guide helps interpret Random Forest regression results and understand variable importance.
rf_cv_plot_info: Cross-validation plot shows model performance across different data splits.
rf_metrics_interpretation: Metrics (R¬≤, RMSE, MAE) quantify prediction accuracy. Higher R¬≤ and lower errors indicate better performance.
rf_importance_interpretation: Feature importance shows which medium components most influence fermentation outcomes.
rf_train_interpretation: Training predictions show how well the model fits the data used to build it.
rf_test_interpretation: Test predictions evaluate model performance on unseen data, indicating generalization ability.
